column2: Water Resources and Municipal Engineer vacancy at Neilsoft Pvt Ltd Neilsoft is currently seeking an Intermediate Engineer to join our Infrastructure Team located at our Pune office working on overseas projects. Scope of work typically involves design of wet utilities infrastructure delivering water sector assets including pumping stations, networks (gravity and pumped), storage reservoirs, and treatment works. Role Summary  Experience : 2  to 7 years Location:Pune Responsibilities/Key Competencies / Skills  	Professional Engineer designation with minimum 3+ years of wet utility design  experience in Water, Storm water management, Sewerage, Water resources planning/engineering experience in a consulting environment; 	Significant experience in drainage applications, the design and analysis of stormwater management facilities, storm sewers and watercourses. Knowledge and experience in watercourse management including erosion control, water quality, slope stability and natural channel design. Experience in the design of sanitary sewer systems and water distribution systems is an asset; 	Knowledge of other modelling software such as WaterGEMS, SewerGEMS, StormCAD, PCSWMM, HEC-HMS, HY8, CulvertMaster, etc. will be an added advantage; 	Candidates with Swedish experience  Key Competencies/Qualifications  	Bachelor of Engineering, Master?? in Water Resources Engineering or Environmental Engineering shall be advantage; 	3 to 6 years of experience in Civil 3D drafting and design; 	Demonstrated analytical (data collection, compilation and analysis), communication (verbal and written ??including technical writing), reporting, and project management skills; and 	Knowledge of other modelling software such as WaterGEMS, SewerGEMS, StormCAD, PCSWMM, HEC-HMS, HY8, CulvertMaster, etc. will be an added advantage; 	Candidates with Swedish experience  Thanks and Regards, Monika Mandawdhare I Talent Aquisition Executive. -------------------------------------------------------------------------- Neilsoft PLtd. Pride Parmar Galaxy, 8th Floor,Pune- 411001 India Tel: 912067062200 Ext: 1282 Email: monika.mandawdhare@neilsoft.com | www.neilsoft.com

column2: Job Description: We are seeking a highly capable Surveyor to join our team. You will provide valuable support to our surveying team with actual survey work and doing the survey drawings. Your expertise in LIDAR surveying and strong technical skills will be instrumental in ensuring accurate and efficient completion of surveying projects. Responsibilities : Collect and process LIDAR data using surveying equipment and software. Conduct quality control checks on LIDAR data to ensure accuracy and completeness. Assist in the preparation of survey plans and reports, incorporating LIDAR data. Collaborate with surveying team members to identify areas for improvement in LIDAR data collection and analysis processes. Maintain and update database systems with surveying data. Assist in the creation of digital elevation models (DEMs) using LIDAR data. Provide support in the post-processing of data to generate point cloud and other relevant output. Perform topographic and as-built surveys Assist with construction staking or site layout surveys Coordinate with field survey crews Assist with zoning and permitting applications Provide technical expertise to other individuals in the company Effectively managing workflow and also proposals. Requirements : 5-10 years of experience Bachelor's degree in surveying, civil or related field. Familiar with scanning registration, drones and surveying  Strong working knowledge of LIDAR surveying principles and techniques. Proficiency in LIDAR data collection equipment and software. Familiarity with surveying software such as Microstation, AutoCAD, ArcGIS, or similar. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment. Knowledge of surveying standards and regulations. Familiarity with remote sensing and photogrammetry techniques is a plus. Certification in LIDAR surveying is a plus

column2: Data Collection:    Operate aerial survey equipment, including UAVs (drones), manned aircraft, and associated sensors (e.g., LiDAR, multispectral, thermal).       Survey Planning:    Collaborate with project managers to develop flight plans and survey strategies that meet project requirements.       Equipment Maintenance:    Perform routine maintenance and troubleshooting of survey equipment to ensure optimal performance.       Data Processing:    Process raw aerial data using specialized software to produce accurate and high-quality survey results.       Quality Control:    Ensure data accuracy and completeness through rigorous quality control procedures.       Documentation:    Maintain detailed records of survey operations, including flight logs, maintenance reports, and data processing logs.       Compliance:    Adhere to all safety regulations and legal requirements related to aerial surveys and UAV operations.       Collaboration:    Work closely with other team members, including GIS specialists, engineers, and environmental scientists, to deliver integrated solutions.
